intro: Onosma echioides subsp. pyrenaica, commonly known as the Pyrenean horsegram, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and hairy foliage. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers arranged in dense clusters, which attract pollinators such as bees.
